Title: Production Canada (CSCPRC) Backups Start
Brief Description:
CSCPRC backups will kick off. Emails will be received to monitor backups but ensure that you are logged into CSCPRC and keeping an eye on OPCOMS and job failures. 
See Documentation

Title: Receive SSL IPI and SSL
Brief Description: Ops will receive the IPI and SSL Processes email

Title: Confirm All URRs Are Complete
Brief Description: At this stage there should be no URRs running. You can confirm this using the command in the comments
Comments:
JD J:RS_UR

As jobs do no retain on completion in NA, if the output is blank then they are all complete

Title: Release Potential Incomplete URR Job If All URRs Are done
Brief Description: If all URRs are complete, you can release the POTENTIAL_INCOMPLETE_URRS Job on the HOUSEKEEPING queue. If there are any outstanding URRs the job must be held before it's due to release at 04:30 EST

Title: Check POTENTIAL_INCOMPLETE_URR's report that will arrive as an email into the NA Inbox
Brief Description: The email will detail any outstanding URR's that need investigation. If there are any coming back on the report, then the SUBMIT_JOBS_AFTER_ALL_URRS will not be triggered. Follow the linked documentation to resolve.

Title: Check for holding jobs
Brief Description: Check for holding jobs on production systems.
Comments:
JD S:HOLDING 

All jobs on SCRIP$CANCELLED can be ignored
Any holding jobs should be sent to !NA CT Scrip Support

Title: Semi-Annual Optimise Jobs Parallel & Serial Check
Brief Description: Check if Semi-Annual Optimise Jobs Parallel & Serial need to be scheduled this week and consider the simulation & heads up email that need to be sent to all parties involved
Comments: Hyperlink only links to Parallel Schedule, also remember to check Serial Schedule.

Title: Send the Linux UAT/CSATSC aborted URR Report.
Comments: Send to Brenda Bicknell and Krishna Kumbhar

Title: Send Escalated Job Report To Scrip Support
Brief Description: See Documentation
Comments:
!NA CT Scrip Support Canton; #CA CS MON PNI's to Recon; #GL SO NA Operations 

Template attached to documentation tab

Title: Monitor QUICKP Jobs
Brief Description:
QUICKP jobs begin to run on Production, monitor these to completion and add MSGSETUP's to companies where necessary to get the jobs running.
See Documentation

Title: DPA Backup Report
Brief Description:
The report will be sent to #GL SO NA Operations mailbox. An SD ticket will need to be raised, report saved onto the W drive & the SD ticket number saved on the NA shift handover
See Documentation

Title: Stop All Defrags
Brief Description:
Stop all currently running defrag processes.
See Documentation
Comments: Monday-Friday Ops must ensure all defrags are stoped by 07:00 EST time. On a weekend any defrags that are running can be left running, unless it is a DR weekend (calendar link in doc), or there is any special processing happening on a certain disk (such as mega divs/bulk settlements - check handover

Title: Walmart Payroll Processing
Brief Description: This runs after the URR and is called SPE503_HLDADD_UPDATE_WMT

Title: Morning Tasks
Brief Description:
Complete the Umenu option for Morning Tasks
See Documentation
Comments: Umenu > Ops > Daily > Morn

Title: Send NA Shift Report
Comments: Send shift report !GL SO NA ALL Shift Reporting

Title: Backupdisk Cleanup
Brief Description:
Check Backupdisk space on CSAPRC, CSATSC, CSADSC
See Documentation

Title: EDC_TST URR
Brief Description:
Include Company EDC_TST to the URR Schedule
See Documentation

Title: Stop Networker Backups
Brief Description:
Stop running Server Backups - Kill All (Excluding any groups that have DO_NOT_KILL in the name).
See Documentation
Comments: Stop all running backups for CARNETWDZ2 and CARNETWDZ3

Title: Create Backup Checksheets
Brief Description:
Create Backup Checksheets for both VMS & Server Networker backups. Templates are found in comments section.
See Documentation

Title: Check Handover/Service Point for Fast Terms / AD-HOC Processing
Brief Description: Before running the batch, check the handover/emails to see if there’s any ad-hoc processing this evening that requires special attention. This could be Fast Terminations, in which these need to run at 18:30 EST promptly, or you may be asked to bring forward an update (which doesn’t require any authorisation if from a product support team if to run after 17:00 EST). Or release a certain job after update. There could be multiple things that can be requested.

Title: Run SETQUE Command and Change Queue Limits
Brief Description:
Run SETQUE command, confirm all queues are started with STPQ. Start any that arent started. 

Set all queue limits as detailed in document.
Comments:
Queue Limits should now be:
Highprior* = 20
Day* =12
Par_Exe* =1
Posturr_Exe* =1

Title: DSM Reports
Brief Description:
Process the Disk Space Monitor Reports sent to the mailbox.
See Documentation

Title: Check total number of jobs
Brief Description: At around 19:30 check check the total number of jobs on the system and fill the totals in on the shift report
Comments:
BQ 
JD FT:

Title: Workstation Backups Begin
Brief Description:
Snaps for these will begin and then their backups will start shortly after. Emails will be received when these start & complete but ensure that you are logged into a CSABNC session and monitoring for failures and OPCOMS.
See Documentation

Title: Queue Limit Changes
Brief Description: Assuming the UBN and UCB1 URRS and XTRACT Jobs are all complete and the Highprior* queue is drained, then you can run the next set of queue changes. If there are still outstanding UBN and UCB1 jobs then hold off on these changes until 22:30 EST
Comments:
Check UBN and UCB1 queues are drained using:
show queue UBN/all
show queue UCB1/all
The above should show no RS_UR or *XTRACT* Jobs

Queue job limits should now be:
DAY* = 12
HIGHPRIO* = 5
PAR_EXE* = 10
DAY* = 12
POSTURR = 1

Title: Check Canada (CSCPRC) URRs
Brief Description: Ensure the 16 Canada URRs have started on the CSCPRC Node.

Title: MSGLOGGER Check for Backups
Brief Description: Logon to Umenu and check the URR MSGLOGGER Status
Comments: Umenu > Ops > Daily > URRMSG

Title: Walmart Payroll Processing - SPE503_HLDADD_UPDATE_WMT
Brief Description:
WEDNESDAY DAY - SAME WEEK AS THE US PAYROLL FILE. RUNS AFTER THE URR.
When the WALMART Payroll Proccessing job (SPE503_HLDADD_UPDATE_WMT) is complete, abort the "CBPEND_PROCESS_WMT" job. Then using the DENT command, delete it to make sure it isn't re-run.
See Documentation
Comments: EXTREMELY CRITICAL

Title: Bank of New York Mellon - BNY_DAILY_XTRACT Jobs
Brief Description: Check to see that all BNY_DAILY_XTRACT Jobs are completed
Comments: JD J:BNY_DAILY_XTRACT

Title: Walmart Payroll File Transfer (US)
Brief Description:
MONDAY  ON RECEIPT OF EMAIL - IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOU CHECK THE DOCUMENTATION AND THE INCLUDED SCHEDULE!
See Documentation
Comments: EXTREMELY CRITICAL

Title: Walmart Payroll File Transfer (CANADA)
Brief Description:
TUESDAY ON RECEIPT OF EMAIL - IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOU CHECK THE DOCUMENTATION AND THE INCLUDED SCHEDULE!
See Documentation
Comments: EXTREMELY CRITICAL

Title: WALMART PAYROLL FILE TRANSFER (RHODE ISLAND)
Brief Description:
TUESDAY ON RECEIPT OF EMAIL - IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOU CHECK THE DOCUMENTATION AND THE INCLUDED SCHEDULE!
See Documentation
Comments: EXTREMELY CRITICAL

Title: Start Defrags for COMMONAPP
Comments: Umenu > Ops > Daily > DFG

Title: Check Daily Outbound BNYM ADR File Transfer
Brief Description:
Emails with subjects:
##### Pull Outgoing BNYM ADR Transaction File from SCRIP Production (CSAPRC) #####
##### Send Outgoing ADR Transaction Production File to BNY-Mellon #####
Should be received by 04:30AM GMT
Comments: If no emails are received, check that APPEND_SORT_BNY_DAILY_TRAN  has completed on Prod. If job has completed but no emails then contact On-Call Data Ops

Title: Start Defrags for the 3 Production Cluster Datadisks
Comments:
FOR THE NAMES OF THE 3 DATADISKS TO BE DEFRAGMENTED, REFER TO THE DAILY E-MAIL FROM “System on CSAPRC system@navmsmail.net”  with the subject:
“Daily DEFRAG candidates”. It arrives in the NA group Inbox at approximately 6 PM Eastern Time

Title: Start Defrags of DUALLOGDISK4 and DUALLOGDISK5
Start Defrags for SCRIPCOYDISK and SCRIPLOGDISK and SCRIPLOG2
Check for any overrunning backups on Production. Terminate the ones still running
Brief Description:
***TIME CRITICAL***
JD NW_BCK$CSABN* J:CSAPRC
If anything appears, abort it. 
Terminate clone. 
Delete entry.

***DO NOT DELETE AFTER MIDNIGHT EST***

Title: Update backup totals on NA shift report
Brief Description: Around that time we will receive an email with the details of backups, please update totals in the shift report
Comments: if email is not received we can use this command in VMS in CSABN cluster instead @OPSCOM:CK_NW_BCKPS , and then update the shift report with the totals.

Title: CSAPRC & Non-Production Snaps Begin
Brief Description:
Snaps for these will begin, starting with production. Emails will be received when these start & complete but ensure that you are logged into a CSABNC session and monitoring for failures and OPCOMS
See Documentation

Title: Queue Limit Changes
Brief Description: The MAINURR queue should complete all its URRs by 00:00. Assuming the DAY queue is no higher than 4000 you can run the next set of queue changes. On a month end you may see this time vary. If the queue count is high it’s a good idea to let the DAY queues drain to around 4000 before running the changes, therefore on a month end you will probably need to hold off for an hour or so before making these changes.
Comments:
Queue job limits should now be:
DAY* = 12
HIGHPRIO* = 5
PAR_EXE* = 10
DAY* = 12
POSTURR = 5

Title: Check for Long Running URRs
Brief Description: At this point most of the main URRS should be done (unless it’s a month end) and we are just waiting for the rest at 03:00. It’s a good idea to check what is left.
Comments:
JD J:RS_UR

As jobs on NA VMS don’t retain on completion you should only see the URRs left to run at 3am.
